title: ResuRalph
technologies: Python, Flask, Docker, AWS (Lambda, SQS, S3, DynamoDB), OpenAI
description: A Discord bot designed to streamline collaborative resume reviews for a community of 2,000+ students, eliminating cluttered review threads and combining both peer and AI-powered resume annotations directly in Discord.
achievements: Implemented an upload-to-review system with AWS S3 for uploads, Hypothes.is for in-line resume annotations, and version tracking via DynamoDB, driving fast and iterative peer reviews
Re-architected EC2-based infrastructure to a serverless, event-driven model using AWS Lambda, AWS SQS, and Discord Webhooks, reducing hosting costs by over 90% and enabling on-demand execution
problemSolved: Students needed a way to efficiently collaborate on resume reviews without cluttering Discord threads, as well as a fix to the problem of constantly needing to re-download PDF files and send feedback as long Discord messages.

title: Bloomwatch
subtitle: Canadian Space Agency Hackathon 1st Place ðŸ¥‡
description: A full-stack web application built in a team of 3 using satellite data to detect and visualize harmful algal blooms and their contributing factors.
achievements: Won 1st place at the Canadian Space Agency Hackathon
Enabled environmental agencies to see exactly where to place preventative measures through data visualization
problemSolved: Harmful Algal Blooms are projected to cost Canada 5.3 billion over the next 30 years. Environmental agencies needed a tool to identify and monitor harmful algal blooms in water bodies along with their contributing factors, allowing them to instantly visualize where to implement prevantative measures like vegatative strips.

title: PicklePal
technologies: PyTorch, OpenCV, YOLOv8, React, FastAPI, Python
description: A computer vision-based application to analyze pickleball matches, detecting shot techniques, ball hits, and rallies to help players improve their game.
achievements: Trained a PyTorch neural network to classify forehand vs backhand shot techniques based on player joint positions, achieving 87% test accuracy
Implemented an OpenCV video processing pipeline with MediaPipe for player key-point extraction and custom trained YOLOv8 models to detect players, balls, and court lines
problemSolved: Pickleball players lacked accessible tools to analyze their gameplay and improve their technique. Manual video review is time-consuming and lacks the precision of automated computer vision analysis.
